byline.contributor: Najim Rahim reported from Boz Qandahari, and Rod Nordland from Kabul, Afghanistan. Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul.
byline.original: By NAJIM RAHIM and ROD NORDLAND

abstract: Residents of village on outskirts of Kunduz, Afghanistan, deny Taliban had been in area and played role in battle in which at least two American Special Forces soldiers, 36 civilians and 14 Taliban fighters were killed; episode has left many unanswered questions.

headline.print_headline: Amid Blood, a Refrain: Taliban? None Here.
headline.main: On Street Where U.S. Soldiers Died, Afghans Say: Taliban? What Taliban?

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: At least five dead coalition soldiers, 14 dead Taliban and 36 dead civilians after a battle near Kunduz — and then there are the unanswered questions....
lead_paragraph: At least five dead coalition soldiers, 14 dead Taliban and 36 dead civilians after a battle near Kunduz — and then there are the unanswered questions.
